s.text: Clinton read his prepared opening remarks (in which he compared the event to one of FDR's fireside chats) from a teleprompter.
One of the few sparks of interest was a question about whether Clinton, if he didn't live in the White House, would put aside food for a possible Y2K catastrophe.
The event might have worked slightly better if he had been given a mouse to flag questions he wanted to answer or a keyboard to send messages back to the control room.
